metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27351 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Various memory and file descriptor leaks were found in apt-python files python/arfile.cc, python/tag.cc, python/tarfile.cc, aka GHSL-2020-170. This issue affects: python-apt 1.1.0~beta1 versions prior to 1.1.0~beta1ubuntu0.16.04.10; 1.6.5ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.6.5ubuntu0.4; 2.0.0ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.0.0ubuntu0.20.04.2; 2.1.3ubuntu1 versions prior to 2.1.3ubuntu1.1;

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-apt - 1.1.0~beta1ubuntu0.16.04.10
python-apt-common - 1.1.0~beta1ubuntu0.16.04.10
python3-apt - 1.1.0~beta1ubuntu0.16.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-apt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.0~beta1ubuntu0.16.04.10').
